page.title: 05AGRICULTURE
page.content: The majority of the farms are mixed farms with almost no one farm specialising completely in one kind of activity.Some farms concentrate on arable farming, some of them concentrate on livestock,but everyone of the farms diversifies.There is one large pig farm producing pigs for bacon.Three farms were surveyed to provide most of the information.The land slopes steeply from the West, downhill to the flatter land in the East, which is only 6 metres above sea level.Farms and fields are smaller on the higher ground than on the lower ground. Smaller farms are about 11 acres in size and may have up to 18 fields each.The soil is acidic here but the land is flat and easy to farm.Animals kept on the farm include Fresians and Ayreshire cows,a Hererford bull.
